basics.name: Yiwei Wang
basics.summary: Currently employed at Red Brick University. Short biography for the left-hand sidebar

Research Experiences.Institution: Faculty of Science and Engineering, UNNC
Research Experiences.Subject: Prototype Development of a 3 Degree-of-Freedom Parallel
Descriptions: • Prototype Development of a 3 Degree-of-Freedom Parallel
• Responsible for building a model of a 3-degree-of-freedom parallel actuator based on existing research, especially from the book Robot Modelling and Control
• Designed the trajectory of the actuator by drawing on knowledge of statistics and dynamics, gaining knowledge about robot modelling and control
• Applied theoretical knowledge in control of aerospace systems, dynamics, and flight mechanics to solve a practical problem

Research Experiences.Institution: Faculty of Science and Engineering, UNNC
Research Experiences.Subject: Multidisciplinary Design Optimization of Propeller Performance and Noise Project
Descriptions: • Modelled the propeller design using SolidWorks
• Carried out CFD analysis using Ansys, specifically CFX and CFD (Fluent) to simulate the different blade performances of the vehicle

Research Experiences.Subject: Tail-Sitter Vertical Take-Off and Landing (VTOL) Drone Project
Descriptions: • Applied control theory to enable the drone to operate successfully in the main phases of flight (take-off, landing, and cruise)
• Used principles of UAV electronic control system and Simulink software to stabilize the flight of the drone

Research Experiences.Subject: Design and development of 5 Axis Industrial Cutting Machine Project
Descriptions: • Liaised with company to determine project requirements
• Gained knowledge of integrated circuits while working on the project
• Integrated C programme for automating the probes object detection and tilt angle
• Demonstrated excellent communication skills when speaking to various teams within the company

Research Experiences.Institution: ASME K-16/IEEE EPS 2024 Design Competition, United States
Research Experiences.Subject: Design and development of a type of heat sink with good heat transfer performance and light weight
description: • Led my team to design an efficient heat sink, achieving a runner-up award
• Carried out CFD analysis to optimise the design and incorporated design features to allow the component to be 3D printable

publications.name: Surrogate-based Multifidelity Robust Optimization for Ducted Fan Blade Aerodynamic Design
publications.summary: The paper introduces a multifidelity robust optimization method for ducted fan blade design, combining high-fidelity CFD models with surrogate modeling.
